addrTypeSelection.legacy-text:
Legacy address starting with a 1,
 allowed characters: 1-9, a-z, A-Z, not allowed characters: 0, O, l, I
 up to eight characters
 Higher transaction fees
addrTypeSelection.nested-segwit-text:
Nested SegWit allowed first characters: 2-9, A-Q from second character: 0-9, a-z, A-Z, not allowed characters: 0, O, l, I
 up to eight characters
 Medium transaction fees
addrTypeSelection.native-segwit-text:
Native SegWit Bech32 address
 starts with bc1q.
 Allowed characters: 0, 2-9, a-z, not allowed characters: 1, b, i, o
 up to ten characters
 Lower transaction fees

What characters should be included in the address?

prefix.disallowed-prefix: Disallowed character detected in address prefix

pubkey.title: 3. Enter the public key
pubkey.text: Uncompressed and compressed public keys accepted
pubkey.dialog-btn: Where to get the public key from?
pubkey.aboutpubkey-text: A public key is a long alphanumeric string used in cryptography to receive Bitcoin transactions. It is part of a key pair, where the other part is the private key. The public key can be safely shared with others, while the private key must remain secret to secure ownership of the Bitcoins.
pubkey.chooseWallet-text: Both Blue Wallet and Electrum Wallet are known for their security, but many users consider Electrum Wallet to be particularly secure and reliable. It is a widely used and well-documented open-source wallet that offers advanced security features.
pubkey.exportpubkey-text:
To export the compressed public key in Electrum Wallet, follow these steps:
 1. Open Electrum and navigate to your wallet.
 2. Click on "View" in the top menu and select "Show Addresses".
 3. Click on the "Addresses" button in the header.
 4. Select one of the addresses and label it, e.g., "key for vanityaddr".
 5. Right-click on this labeled address and select "Details".
 The public key (WIF-compressed) will be displayed.
 6. Copy the public key or scan it as a QR code.
 7. Paste it into the input field for the Public Key.
pubkey.keypair-generate-btn: Generate a keypair on your own risk
pubkey.entropy-text: Drag the mouse or swipe with the finger over the screen to generate entropy.
pubkey.security-hint: Please note that this is not the best way to generate a key pair. We do not store the private key, import the private key into a wallet.
pubkey.private-key: Private Key - is not saved by us!
pubkey.public-key: Public Key - is saved for calculation!
pubkey.private-key-copy-description: Your Key is copied, be carefulthis this is not the best practice to handle Private Keys.
